questiontext.text: Which statement is correct?  I. According to a research firm, the probability that a randomly selected American will be injured by lightning in a given year is: 1/785.000. II. According to my neighbor, the probability that the tomatoes he has planted will be fit for consumption in the next month: one-half.

answer.text: I is a situation with relative frequency, II is not.

feedback.text: I is a situation with a relative frequency, II is not…: Correct

answer.text: I is not a situation with a relative frequency, II is.

feedback.text: I is not a situation with a relative frequency, II is: Incorrect

answer.text: I and II are both situations with a relative frequency.

feedback.text: I and II are both situations with a relative frequency…: Incorrect

answer.text: I and II are neither situations with a relative frequency.

feedback.text: I and II are neither situations with a relative frequency…: Incorrect
